news_header: Two major lenders have launched mortgage deals with interest rates below 4%, driven by competition and the Bank of England's potential rate cuts. However, these deals may not be accessible to all borrowers due to high fees and deposit requirements.
news_original_title: Mortgage rates cut below 4% as competition picks up
news_text: The average rate for two-year fixed deals is currently 5.48%. Borrowers are encouraged to review their options as many fixed-rate mortgages are set to expire soon, potentially leading to higher payments. The Bank of England is expected to make further rate cuts, which could benefit borrowers in the long run.
